articles.title: Australians have unequal rights to die. For some families, that only adds to the pain - The Guardian
articles.description: Sue Walton vowed to be with her terminally ill daughter when she decided to end her life. But NSW laws against voluntary assisted dying kept them apart
articles.content: Katie Leigh French was Sue Waltons stepdaughter, but Walton never really made the distinction. One of six daughters in a blended family, French like her stepmum worked in aged care, and the pair used… [+9860 chars]

articles.title: Australians being held in Syria are in conditions that 'meet the standard of torture', UN says - ABC News
articles.description: A letter from the UN Human Rights Council says 46 Australian citizens, including 30 children, are believed to be held in sordid conditions in Syrian detention camps.
articles.content:
The United Nations has warned the Australian government that 46 Australian citizens, including 30 children, being held in squalid camps in north east Syria are enduring conditions akin to torture.
